name: Mount & Blade: With Fire and Sword
summary: In an open sand box world you choose your allies, your enemies, what provinces to conquer, what castles to siege and what quests to embark on. With Fire and Sword builds and expands upon the highly regarded combat system from Mount & Blade: Warband. Firearms have been introduced to the battlefield. Additionally, muskets and pistols can now be used as sidearms in hand-to-hand combat to quickly drop your foes. In addition to the enhanced singleplayer mode, With Fire & Sword also provides a host of original multiplayer content including the new game mode: Captain.

esrb.synopsis: This is an action role-playing game in which players assume the role of a warrior in medieval Europe. Players explore 'open-world' environments as they complete quests, forge alliances, and battle enemy forces. Players use swords, axes, spears, muskets, and catapults to defeat enemy troops in hand-to-hand combat. Battles are accompanied by realistic gunfire, sword-slashing effects, cries of pain, and brief splashes of blood; bloodstains sometimes appear on characters' clothing and/or armor. During the course of the game, the dialogue occasionally references suggestive material (e.g., '[W]henever her husband is away, she beds her stable boys and anyone else she can lay her hands on' and 'Our priest gave communion to two women from our parish—whole night long.'). Some dialogue also references drugs or alcohol (e.g., 'Yesterday a merchant got too high on hashish,' 'Drink some of this vodka, and your sorrows will be gone,' and 'Students got in a drunken brawl at the inn again.'). The words 'sh*t,' 'b*tch,' and 'bastard' appear in dialogue.
